RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui doutorado em Fisica - Universit degli Studi dell'Aquila (2006). Atualmente professor doutor da Universidade Estadual de Campinas-UNICAMP.Tem experincia na rea de fisica de neutrinos e materia escura. Foi membro das colaboraes ICARUS e Warp no Laboratorio Nacional de Gran Sasso -LNGS (Italia). Ainda no LNGS participa do experimento DarkSide cujo objetivo principal a deteccao de wimps. Faz parte tambm dos experimentos no Fermilab LArIAT, SBND e DUNE dedicados a fisica de neutrinos. um dos lideres do sistema de foton deteo do experimento DUNE. Dedica se a P&D em detectores do tipo TPC em argonio liquido.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: doctorate at Fisica from Universit degli Studi dell'Aquila (2006). Has experience in Physics, focusing on Physics of Elementary Particles and Fields

DOUTORADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Analysis and Simulation of events with scintillation light emission from the ICARUS T600 LAr detector

PESQUISA-E-DESENVOLVIMENTO.NOME-UNIDADE: Departamento de Cronologia, Raios Csmicos, Altas Energias e Lptons

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: The SBND (Short Baseline Neutrino Detector) is intended to be the near detector of MicroBooNE (a 170 ton LAr TPC) on the neutrino beam of the Fermilab. It will operate a 40 ton LAr TPC and in combination with MicroBooNE will provide a clear interpretation of the anomalous signal observed by MiniBooNE in neutrinos and enable important additional opportunities to test for new physics through disappearance channels. In addition SBND will represent a valuable development project for the future DUNE experiment. In fact, the cryostat, cryogenic system, TPC and light collection systems, high voltage configuration and electronics readout should be designed in view of a possible implementation in the DUNE. The experiment is planned to start taking data in 2017 at Fermilab.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Fsica das Partculas Elementares e Campos

PESQUISA-E-DESENVOLVIMENTO.NOME-UNIDADE: Departamento de Cronologia, Raios Csmicos, Altas Energias e Lptons

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: The LArIAT experiment, a 170l LAr TPC, is actually taking data on the Fermilab Test Beam Facility, which provides low momenta, 0.2 - 2.0 GeV, particles. It will address some of the crucial aspects related to the calibration and to the full comprehension of LAr TPCs. In particular e− to γ shower separation, charge sign determination, particle identification, π and K interactions in LAr. I am working in the photon detection system of the detector.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Fsica das Partculas Elementares e Campos

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-UNIDADE: Departamento de Cronologia, Raios Csmicos, Altas Energias e Lptons

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Projeto FAPESP: Jovem pesquisador - Liquid argon program at UNICAMP
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Two of the most important programs in particle physics for the next decade con- cern the study of the properties of neutrinos and the search for dark matter particles in the form of WIMPs (Weakly Interacting Massive Particle). Next generation ex- periments on neutrinos are designed to investigate mainly CP-violation in the lepton sector, the mass hierarchy, and neutrinos produced in supernova explosions. Next generation direct dark matter experiments aim to reach a sensitivity in the cross section for WIMP interactions at the level of 10 47 cm2. In both cases one of the most promising technique is the one based on the use of liquid argon time projection chambers. This project proposes to open two new lines of research in the framework of liq- uid argon scintillation light detection. The first consists in the development of an innovative device - ARAPUCA - for the collection and detection of liquid argon scintillation light, which promises to have much higher performances with respect to all the other solutions proposed up to now in this field. The second is the full characterization of the properties of wavelength shifting com- pounds that can be used in combination with liquid argon, in view of recent ex- perimental results that have modified the common understanding of their working principle.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de So Paulo

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-UNIDADE: Departamento de Cronologia, Raios Csmicos, Altas Energias e Lptons

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Projeto FAPESP - Organizao de Evento Cientfico - DUNE Workshop
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The neutrino program based at the Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory is aggregating an important international community of experimental and theoretical physicists. The flagship project of the program is the Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment (DUNE), a long baseline experiment, which will assess some of the most important open questions of neutrino physics such as CP-violation and the hierarchy of neutrino masses. The huge active mass of the far detector will also allow to develop a rich program of non accelerator physics, that includes the search for proton decay, the detection of supernova neutrinos and of atmospheric neutrinos. A short baseline program is being carried on in parallel to the long baseline one and will give a definitive proof of the existence or not of a fourth generation, sterile, neutrino. The workshop will focus on the actual status of the Fermilab neutrino program with emphasis on the DUNE, protoDUNE, SBND (Short Baseline Neutrino Detector) and LArIAT (Liquid Argon in a Test Beam) experiments and on the short and long term developments. It will be widely discussed the involvement of the Sao Paulo and Brazilian groups and the wide range of possibilities for new groups willing to join the program. In particular it will be shown that some contributions to the Fermilab neutrino program are under development by Brazilian groups. From the theoretical point of view the DUNE and SBND potential to probe extra-dimensions, violation of Lorentz symmetry, proton decay are some examples of investigation. From the experimental side, Brazilian groups are actively participating to the design and construction of the DUNE, prtoDUNE and SBND experiment, to the data taking and analysis of the LArIAT and are leading the effort of developing a new system for Liquid Argon scintillation light detection, which is known as AR

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de So Paulo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Projeto FAPESP: Bolsa de Pesquisa ? Exterior - ARAPUCA no protoDUNE
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment (DUNE) will be the first mega sci- ence program of the US soil, with about one thousand of researchers participating. The Collaboration is planning to realize a World class experiment aimed to address some of the open questions in neutrino physics, namely the measurement of the CP violating phase in the leptonic sector, the hierarchy of neutrino masses and the 23. The DUNE foresees the realization of a neutrino beam and of a near detector, both located at the Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory (Fermilab), Illinois, and a far detector based on the technology of Liquid Argon Time Projection Chambers that will be installed at the Sanford Underground Research Facility in South Dakota, 1,300 km faraway. The ARAPUCA is an innovative device for liquid argon scintil- lation light detections, which aims to set a new status of the art in this field and to become the reference technology for the DUNE experiment. The Collaboration has approved the installation of some ARAPUCA arrays inside the protoDUNE, the prototype of the DUNE far detector, which will be built in 2017/2018 at CERN. Their performances will be benchmarked with other devices based on different tech- nologies. I am proposing to spend 90 days at CERN for the installation, test and operation of the ARAPUCA inside protoDUNE and of the entire Photon Detection System of the protoDUNE experiment, since I have been appointed as responsible by the Collaboration.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-UNIDADE: Departamento de Cronologia, Raios Csmicos, Altas Energias e Lptons

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Projeto Fapesp - sao paulo SCHOOL OF ADVANCED SCIENCE ON EXPERIMENTAL NEUTRINO PHYSICS
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A proposta da escola disseminar informaes e mtodos da area, especialmente a estudantes e jovens pesquisadores interessados em iniciar/continuar estudos em fsica de neutrinos. Dever, portanto, apresentar uma viso geral de tpicos-chave cargo de especialistas renomados e tambm de pesquisadores brasileiros de modo a colocar os participantes em contato direto com quem j trabalha com o assunto no pas. Isso abrir caminhos para a implementao de novos projetos e o uso de instalaes no estado de So Paulo para fortalecer a comunidade.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de So Paulo

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Nuclear Instruments & Methods in Physics Research. Section A, Accelerators,

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: ICARUS T600 detector exploited the technique of the Time Projection Chambers (TPC) and liquid argon (TLAr=89oK) as active medium for the detection of ionizing particles. The detector consisted of two identical cryostats, each one hosting a TPC that observed about 600 tons of LAr (300 tons each). The detector has been operating at the Gran Sasso National Laboratory (LNGS) up to 2013 and its scientific programme was based on the study of atmospheric neutrinos, long-baseline neutrinos from the CNGS (CERN Neutrino to Gran Sasso) beam and proton decay searches. During my Laurea Thesis work I participated to the installation and run of the ICARUS 10m3 prototype in the external site of the LNGS (Hall di Montaggio ? HdM). I participated to the installation of the Time Projection Chamber and of the photomultipliers to detect scintillation/Cerenkov radiation. I performed the analysis of events induced by cosmic muons in coincidence with light signals. I realized a first full MC simulation including scintillation and Cerenkov light propagation and collection at the PMTs (based on GEANT 3 package). Comparison of Data and MC put in evidence the detection of Cherenkov radiation in liquid argon (for the first time in literature. In 2001 I participated to the test of the ICARUS T600 detector in Pavia (external Run). My PhD work was focused on the analysis of events induced by cosmic rays collected during T600 external run and to the development of MC simulations of processes of light emission (scintillation and Cherenkov) in liquid Argon based on the packages GEANT 3 and GEANT 4. From 2010 to 2013 (up to the end of the ICARUS T600 Run) I have been member of the LNGS cryogenic group that was in charge of running and maintain the ICARUS T600 cryogenic plant. In 2011 I was appointed as one of the on call expert qualified to directly intervene on the detector in case of cryogenic problems (three persons inside the Collaboration).

The WArP experiment was dedicated to the direct detection of Dark Matter in the form of the hypothesized WIMPs particles. The experimental technique was based on the simultaneous detection of scintillation light and ionization charge produced by interacting particles in a liquid argon volume. n the framework of the R&D of the WArP experiment I have been involved in the group that built a dedicated experimental set-up for the measurement of the effects of nitrogen and oxygen contaminations on the liquid argon scintillation light. I had an active part on the design and realization of the set- up and on the data analysis.I participated to the realization and operation of an experimental set-up for the test of wavelength shifting films in liquid argon. This set-up allowed to single out the most efficient configuration of shifter and reflector that has been chosen to be installed in the WArP 100l detector. I realized an experimental set-up for the test of the efficiency of wavelength shifting films in gaseous argon. I coordinated the group that put in operation a small scale prototype (2.3l of liquid argon). I was coordinated the group that realized all the reflecting/shifting foils installed in the WArP 100l detector. I coordinated the group that tested high Quantum Efficiency photomultipliers of new generation by Hamamatsu (R11065). Data analysis leader for active veto. Run Coordinator in 2011.

DarkSide is an experiment devoted to the direct Dark Matter search in form of WIMPS that adopts the technique of the liquid Argon in double phase that has been developed by the WArP experiment. Its main and distinctive characteristic is the use of Argon with a low content of 39Ar, thanks to the fact that it is extracted from underground gas wells. It also implements an active veto based on the use of a boron loaded scintillator that will be capable to reduce the background due to radiogenic neutrons of more than 99.5%. I participated to the commissioning of the DarkSide 50 detector at Gran Sasso National Laboratory as member of the group that manages the cryogenic plant of the experiment. I am part of the group that manages the photo-multipliers of the inner part of the detector.
I have been the Run Manager of the experiment from November 2013 to February 2015.

DUNE is a World class experiment aimed to address some of the most intriguing open problems in particle physics such as CP symmetry violation in neutrino mixing and the neutrino mass hierarchy. Essential parts of the experiment are the near and far detectors that are both based on the liquid argon Time Projection Chamber technique, pioneered by the ICARUS Collaboration. The Collaboration is formed by more than 1100 scientists from more than 30 nations. The Collaboration is organized into 5 Consortia, each one responsible for the construction of a subsystem of the detector.
I am the leader of one of the Consortia: the photon detection Consortium which is formed by more than 200 scientists from 42 Institutions, equally distributed among North America, South America and Europe. The Photon Detection system of the DUNE far detector is based in a device which was proposed by me and by Dr.a Ana Machado, the ARAPUCA. It currently represents the baseline choice of the experiment. I am member of the Executive board, of the Technical Board and of the Financial Board of the Experiment.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: I work in the detection of the liquid argon scintillation light in the DUNE experiment. I proposed, designed and developed a new concept for liquid argon scintillation light detection, which has been named ARAPUCA. It is a trap for photons: they are confined in a box with highly reflective surfaces and are detected with silicon photo-sensors. The system is highly efficient and represent the baseline choice of the DUNE experiment.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Universit degli Studi di Roma Tor Vergata

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Sileye 3 and Altea experiments were dedicated to the study of the light flash phenomenon in human beings outside Earth?s atmosphere. The aim of both experiments was to find correlations between the light flash phenomenon in astronauts with the passage of ionizing particles eventually impinging on particular areas of astronaut?s brain. They were both constituted by silicon strip detectors installed inside the International Space Station (ISS). ? I realized the Monte Carlo simulation of both detectors. I also performed part of the analysis of the data collected by the Sileye3 detector and participated to the realization of a Neural Network for real time particle discrimination and energy reconstruction. Related signed papers: o ?A neural network device for on-line particle identification in cosmic ray experiments.? R. Scrimaglio et al. Nucl. Inst. Meth. A 524 (2004) 152. o ?Simulation of ALTEA experiment on the International Space Station with the Geant 3.21 program?, R. Scrimaglio et al., Advances in Space Research 37(2006) 1770-1776. o ?Analysis of Sileye-3/Alteino data with a neural network technique: Particle discrimination and energy reconstruction? R. Scrimaglio et al., Advances in Space Research 37(2006) 1697-1703.
